abstract: Much ink has been spilled on the question of whether social networking site Facebook will sell out and, if so, for how much. Following Google‘s $1.65 billion acquisition of YouTube last year, rumors percolated that Yahoo and Viacom were interested, and that Facebook’s founder and chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, was holding out for a $2 billion offer.
lead_paragraph: Much ink has been spilled on the question of whether social networking site Facebook will sell out and, if so, for how much. Following Google‘s $1.65 billion acquisition of YouTube last year, rumors percolated that Yahoo and Viacom were interested, and that Facebook’s founder and chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, was holding out for a $2 billion offer.

headline.main: Putting a Price Tag on Facebook: Round 2
